goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog.trans

Class PrologUnify

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.program.goal.prolog.trans.PrologUnify

  • public class PrologUnify
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a unification method for unifying two Prolog terms. One can choose between two different unification algorithms: one is the algorithm of SWI Prolog and works by dispatching the query directly to SWI; the other is a basic unification algorithm without optimizations that is implemented entirely in Java. The latter appears much faster and is hence the default.
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean jUnify
      Flag indicating whether unification queries must be dispatched to the SWI Prolog engine, or handled by the own Java implementation of unification.

      • unify

        public static Substitution unify(jpl.Term aTerm,
                 jpl.Term anotherTerm)
        Unifies the two specified terms, if possible.
        Parameters:
        aTerm - - The left-hand side of the unification.
        anotherTerm - - The right-hand side of the unification.
        Returns:
        A unifier if the terms can be unified (may be empty); null otherwise.
